pull.title: build: Skip i686 build by default in guix and gitian
pull.body:
Closes #17504 

Now that we no longer provide downloads for i686 on our website (https://bitcoincore.org/en/download/), there is no need to build them by default.

i686 can still be built in depends (tested by ci/travis) and in guix/gitian by setting the appropriate `HOSTS`.

depends: Remove reference to win32

win32 is no longer mentioned in doc/build-windows.md

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17595](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17595.html) (guix: Enable building for `x86_64-w64-mingw32` target by dongcarl)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Code review ACK fae9084ac5b10f94bdee54853d307838c4254e9c
Travis fail is the usual s390 fail.
ACK fae9084ac5b10f94bdee54853d307838c4254e9c, I have reviewed the code and it looks OK, I agree it can be merged.

~~Nice! Could probably also remove~~ https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/4c2578706c70148fc001f42a0918a2fb10252b43/contrib/guix/manifest.scm#L150 ~~but not a huge deal.~~

My bad I didn't see "i686 can still be built in depends (tested by ci/travis) and in guix/gitian by setting the appropriate HOSTS."

ACK fae9084ac5b10f94bdee54853d307838c4254e9c patch looks correct

@dnprock 
> @MarcoFalke I came across this PR. I notice there's still references to i686 in gitian-linux descriptor.
> 
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/contrib/gitian-descriptors/gitian-linux.yml#L103
> 
> Should they be removed as well?

From the OP:
> i686 can still be built in depends (tested by ci/travis) and in guix/gitian by setting the appropriate `HOSTS`.
